publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1190 Mr Lloyd Quinan: CAB Inverclyde-That the Parliament congratulates Citizens Advice Scotland on their plans for a Citizens Advice Bureau to be developed in Inverclyde, in co-operation and collaboration with all other existing services, with the key aim of improving social inclusion opportunities throughout the community of Inverclyde.
S1M-1190 CAB Inverclyde (lodged on 18 September 2000) Fiona McLeod*

S1M-1190 Mr Lloyd Quinan: CAB Inverclyde—That the Parliament congratulates Citizens Advice Scotland on their plans for a Citizens Advice Bureau to be developed in Inverclyde, in co-operation and collaboration with all other existing services, with the key aim of improving social inclusion opportunities throughout the community of Inverclyde. Supported by: Fiona McLeod
S1M-1190 CAB Inverclyde (lodged on 18 September 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1190 CAB Inverclyde (lodged on 18 September 2000) Fergus Ewing*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1190 CAB Inverclyde (lodged on 18 September 2000) Alex Neil*, Kay Ullrich*
S1M-1190 CAB Inverclyde (lodged on 18 September 2000) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Robert Brown*

S1M-1190 Mr Lloyd Quinan: CAB Inverclyde—That the Parliament congratulates Citizens Advice Scotland on their plans for a Citizens Advice Bureau to be developed in Inverclyde, in co-operation and collaboration with all other existing services, with the key aim of improving social inclusion opportunities throughout the community of Inverclyde. Supported by: Fiona McLeod, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Fergus Ewing, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Andrew Wilson, Alex Neil, Kay Ullrich, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Robert Brown, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-1190 CAB Inverclyde (lodged on 18 September 2000) Tricia Marwick*, Brian Adam*, Christine Grahame*, Fiona Hyslop*
